Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class BitSet

java.lang.Object
com.shouldis.bitset.BitSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConcurrentBitSet, ImmutableBitSet, InlineBitSet
public class BitSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Representation a fixed number of bits stored within an internal long array, mapping positive integer indices to individual bits and facilitating the manipulation of those individual bits or ranges of bits, as well as retrieving their boolean values.

The bits represented by this BitSet will either be in the live state (1, true), or the dead state (0, false).

BitSet on its own is thread-safe only for read operations, although a Biterator may be used to stream indices in an order and grouping appropriate for parallel manipulation of bits. Alternatively, a ConcurrentBitSet may be used to make all operations thread-safe, requiring no external synchronization at the cost of performance.

While this implementation of BitSet is made extensible, flexible, and readable by how verbose it is made by functional decomposition -- this impacts performance because of the overhead created by the call stack. When no extra functionality or modified behavior is needed, InlineBitSet performs the same operations, but "hot" methods are made faster by inlining.

If size isn't a multiple of 64, there will be hanging bits that exist on the end of the last long within words, which are not accounted for by size. No exception will be thrown when these bit indices are manipulated or read, and in the aggregating functions population(), hashCode(), etc., hanging bits can have their effect on those aggregating functions made consistent by calling clearHanging(). Otherwise, accessing a negative index, or any index greater than or equal to size will cause an IndexOutOfBoundsException to be thrown.

Author:
Aaron Shouldis
See Also:
ConcurrentBitSet, Serialized Form

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean add​(int index)
    Ensures that the bit at the specified index is in the live state.
    void and​(BitSet set)
    Performs a global AND operation on all bits in this BitSet with those in the specified BitSet set.
    void andWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
    Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of an AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
    void apply​(int wordIndex, WordBiFunction function, long mask)
    Applies the specified WordBiFunction function to the word at the specified wordIndex using mask as the second WordBiFunction argument.

    Changes the state of all bits in the specified range [from, to) to the dead state.

    Changes the state of any hanging bits to the dead state in order to maintain their effect on aggregating functions (population(), density(), etc).

    Transforms this BitSet so that each bit matches the state of that in the give set.

  • Field Details

    • serialVersionUID

      private static final long serialVersionUID
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • LIVE

      public static final long LIVE
      Long mask with all bits in the live state. Used for readability in place of -1L (0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF).
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DEAD

      public static final long DEAD
      Long mask with all bits in the dead state. Used for readability in place of 0L (0x0000000000000000).
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • MOD_SIZE_MASK

      protected static final int MOD_SIZE_MASK
      Mask used to compute potentially faster modulo operations. n % m is equivalent to n & (m -1) if n is positive, and m = 2k.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • LOG_2_SIZE

      protected static final int LOG_2_SIZE
      log264. Used to relate bit indices to word indices through bit-shifting as an alternative to division or multiplication by 64.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • size

      public final int size
      The number of indices accessible by this BitSet. Indices 0 through size -1 are accessible.

    • wordCount

      public final int wordCount
      The number of long words contained by this BitSet. Equal to ceiling(size / 64) and words.length.

    • words

      protected final long[] words
      Array holding the long words whose bits are manipulated. Has length ceiling(size / 64). Though this has protected visibility, using methods such as getWord(int), setWord(int, long), andWord(int, long) is preferred over direct access.

  • Constructor Details

    • BitSet

      public BitSet​(int size)
      Creates a BitSet with the specified number of bits indices. Indices 0 through size -1 will be accessible. All bits are initially in the dead state.
      Parameters:
      size - the number of bit indices that this BitSet will hold.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is less than 0.

    • BitSet

      public BitSet​(BitSet set)
      Creates a BitSet which is a clone of the specified BitSet set. The copy will have an identical size, and will copy the contents of set's words through copy(BitSet).
      Parameters:
      set - the BitSet to copy.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public boolean get​(int index)
      Checks the current state of the bit at the specified index. Returns true if the bit is in the live state, and false if it is not.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to examine.
      Returns:
      whether the bit at the specified index is in the live state.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than or equal to size.

    • get

      public int get​(int from, int to)
      Calculates the number of live bits in the specified range [from, to).
      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be checked.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be checked.
      Returns:
      the number of live bits inside the specified range, or 0 if from is greater than or equal to to.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range [0, size).

    • set

      public void set​(int index)
      Changes the state of a bit at the specified index to the live state.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to change to the live state.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative, or greater than or equal to size.

    • set

      public void set​(int from, int to)
      Changes the state of all bits in the specified range [from, to) to the live state. No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to. ConcurrentBitSet will only perform this atomically on each word within the range individually.
      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be changed to the live state.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be changed to the live state.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range [0, size).

    • clear

      public void clear​(int index)
      Changes the state of a bit at the specified index to the dead state.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to clear.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than or equal to size.

    • clear

      public void clear​(int from, int to)
      Changes the state of all bits in the specified range [from, to) to the dead state. No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to. ConcurrentBitSet will only perform this atomically on each word within the range individually.
      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be cleared.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be cleared.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range [0, size).

      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to flip.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than or equal to size.

    • flip

      public void flip​(int from, int to)
      Changes the state of all bits in the specified range [from, to) to their opposites through an XOR operation. No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to. ConcurrentBitSet will only perform this atomically on each word within the range individually.
      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to flip.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to flip.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range [0, size).

    • add

      public boolean add​(int index)
      Ensures that the bit at the specified index is in the live state. If it is not, it will be changed.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to change to the live state.
      Returns:
      whether or not this BitSet was changed as a result.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative, or greater than or equal to size.

      Ensures that the bit at the specified index is the dead state. If it is not, it will be changed.

      Returns:
      whether or not this BitSet was changed as a result.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative, or greater than or equal to size.

      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to read.
      Returns:
      the raw contents of words at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

      public void setWord​(int wordIndex, long word)
      Changes the long word at the specified wordIndex within words, setting it to word.
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to set.
      word - the long value to be set to words at wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

    • andWord

      public void andWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of an AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] &= mask;
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the AND operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the AND operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

    • orWord

      public void orWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of an OR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] |= mask;
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the OR operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the OR operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

    • xOrWord

      public void xOrWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of an XOR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] ^= mask;
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the XOR operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the XOR operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

    • notAndWord

      public void notAndWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of a NOT AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] = ~(words[wordIndex] & mask);
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the NOT AND operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the NOT AND operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

    • notOrWord

      public void notOrWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of a NOT OR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
      Performs words[wordIndex] = ~(words[wordIndex] | mask);
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the NOT OR operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the NOT OR operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

    • notXOrWord

      public void notXOrWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within words to the result of a NOT XOR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] = ~(words[wordIndex] ^ mask);
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the NOT XOR operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the NOT XOR operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

    • setWordSegment

      public void setWordSegment​(int wordIndex, long word, long mask)
      Changes the long word at the specified wordIndex within words such that it retains the previous state of bits where the bits of mask are in the dead state, and takes on the value of bits in word where mask has bits in the live state.
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to change.
      word - the new long value to be set to words.
      mask - the mask used to determine which bits from word will be applied.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

    • flipWord

      public void flipWord​(int wordIndex)

      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the flip operation upon.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

    • fillWord

      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to perform the fill operation upon.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if wordIndex is outside of the range [0, wordCount).

      Throws:

      Parameters:

      function - the WordFunction to apply at the specified wordIndex.

      public void apply​(int wordIndex, WordBiFunction function, long mask)

      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within words to apply the function to.
      function - the WordBiFunction to apply at the specified wordIndex.
      mask - the mask to use in the specified function.

    • clearHanging

      public final void clearHanging()
      Changes the state of any hanging bits to the dead state in order to maintain their effect on aggregating functions (population(), density(), etc).

    • population

      public final int population()
      Calculates the number of live bits within this BitSet. clearHanging() can be used to stop the interference of hanging bits. In certain cases, hanging bits can cause an integer overflow.
      Returns:
      the number of live bits.

    • density

      public final double density​(int from, int to)
      Calculates what percentage of bits in this BitSet are in the live state in the specified range [from, to). clearHanging() can be used to stop the interference of hanging bits.
      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be checked.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be checked.
      Returns:
      the percentage of live bits.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range [0, size).

    • density

      public final double density()
      Calculates what percentage of bits in this BitSet are in the live state. clearHanging() can be used to stop the interference of hanging bits.
      Returns:
      the percentage of live bits.

    • divideSize

      public static final int divideSize​(int n)
      Calculates n / 64. Typically used to translate the index of a bit to the index of the word that bit belongs to within words.
      Parameters:
      n - the number to divide by 64.
      Returns:
      n / 64.

    • multiplySize

      public static final int multiplySize​(int n)
      Calculates n * 64. Typically used to translate the index of a word within words to the index of that word's first bit.
      Parameters:
      n - the number to multiply by 64.
      Returns:
      n * 64.

    • modSize

      public static final int modSize​(int n)
      Calculates n % 64 for positive numbers. Also calculates 64 - (-n % 64) for negative numbers as a side effect.
      Parameters:
      n - the number to modulo by 64.
      Returns:
      the result of the modulo operation.

    • bitMask

      public static final long bitMask​(int index)
      Calculates a mask to represent the bit at which a specific index will be stored within a long word.
      Parameters:
      index - the index to represent as a bit.
      Returns:
      the bit that represents the position of an index within a word.
